page.title: 11WORSHIP IN SANTON DOWNHAM
page.content: There are 2 churches in the area, both are C. of E. and both come under Brandon for administration. The larger at Santon Downham is recorded in the original Domesday Survey of 1089 AD and parts of the existing building could pre_date that record. It is of complicated architecture which has been well researched by John Fitch MA, sometime rector, in a book on sale in the church. This book also has notes about the church at Santon. At St. Mary the Virgin, family service is held every Sunday at 1015 but without Communion on the 1st and 3rd Sundays. Both churches merit a visit by historians and architects for information beyond the scope of this survey.
